fields.summary: Eucalyptus 3.2 Admin Guide:  "Administrators" should be clarified when discussing kernel and ramdisk registration

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: euca-register returns odd error when registering kernel and ramdisk as non-admin, non-eucalyptus (i.e. cloud admin account) user

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When using the admin user of an account on a Eucalyptus 3.2.1 /3.2.2 cloud to register a kernel and ramdisk, the error returned is the exact same:

{code}
# euca-register -a x86_64 appscale/initrd.img-2.6.32-350-ec2.manifest.xml
RegisterImageType: Only administrators can register kernel images.

# euca-register -a x86_64 appscale/vmlinuz-2.6.32-350-ec2.manifest.xml
RegisterImageType: Only administrators can register kernel images.
{code}

When bundling the kernel and ramdisk, you have to use --kernel true option or --ramdisk true option.  Is there any way to have the error message be related to the flag passed for bundling?
fields.summary: euca-register returns the same error when registering a ramdisk and kernel with a non-eucalyptus account (i.e. non cloud admin account)

Code Review Request : EUCA-5721 euca-register returns the same error when registering a ramdisk and kernel with a non-eucalyptus account (i.e. non cloud admin account)

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-5721

diff :  git show --color f319f9291d08f661a539bfb99746dc9b48ba806c

Summary: Error is the same when registering a Kernal or Ramdisk as a non-eucalyptus user.

Solution: Check to see it is a kernal or ramdisk and generate appropriate error

unit test:

1) create new non-eucalyptus account "test-account"
2) as "test-account" admin try and register a ramdisk you should see "ramdisk" as opposed
    to kernel in the error message.

Pass:  euca-register: error (RegisterImageType): Only administrators can register ramdisk images.

Fail:  euca-register: error (RegisterImageType): Only administrators can register kernel images. 

Thx Mike
[~mmunn1] The code looks good to me, easy to review, very straightforward logic.
See EUCA-5722 for commit. The commit for 5722 contains the fix for EUCA-5721 and EUCA-5722

Verified: 

[root@clcfrontend images]# vi /root/test-creds/eucarc
[root@clcfrontend images]# . /root/test-creds/eucarc
[root@clcfrontend images]# euca-register bundle/initrd.tgz.manifest.xml -n my-rd
euca-register: error (RegisterImageType): Only administrators can register ramdisk images.
[root@clcfrontend images]# cp initrd.tgz vmlinuz.tgz
[root@clcfrontend images]# euca-bundle-image -i vmlinuz.tgz -d bundle/ -r x86_64
100% |==================================================================================================| 282.00  B  25.41 kB/s Time: 0:00:00
Wrote manifest bundle/vmlinuz.tgz.manifest.xml
[root@clcfrontend images]# euca-register bundle/vmlinuz.tgz.manifest.xml -n my-rd
euca-register: error (RegisterImageType): Only administrators can register kernel images.
[root@clcfrontend images]#
